title: Dealing data in different language
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
While working on my senior project, the first challenge I faces was translating the data to English.
library(readxl)
library(pander)
library(tidyverse)
library(DT)
library(rmdformats)
Data <- read_excel("~/Desktop/SP_hhungwen/Data/keelung2017-2020-2 .xlsx")

Data%>%
  DT::datatable(class = 'cell-border stripe)%>%
  DT::formatStyle(columns = colnames(.),fontSize = '50%')

title: Welcome to Senior Project Blog

title: Project Background
contents:
Project Proposal Background
Taiwanâ€™s house prices continue to rise since many years ago, especially in the capital city - Taipei. Taipei is a city where has more job opportunities than other cities in Taiwan. Buying a home remains unaffordable for most young Taiwanese. An average household in Taipei needs to pay two-thirds of its income for a mortgage loan. Most of the young adult who works in Taipei would buy/rent a house in neighbor cities of Taipei, and commute by car/bus/ train for 30 min to 1 hour every workday. It causes the house price in neighboring cities to continually increase.
Keelung, the city where I currently live, is one of the neighboring cities of Taipei but also the farthest one compares to other neighboring cities. I would like to analyze the house price changes in Keelung during these five years.
Goals
House price analysis.
Overall Price increasing?
County Average house price differences, and why?
Presold rate of new constrction projects
